text: Alsodes hugoi is a frog. It lives in Chile. ==Body== The frog can be as big as 70.7 mm long from nose to rear end. The skin of the frog's back and legs is light brown with some gold color. There are dark stripes on the legs and black spots on the back. The belly is off-white. ==Home== This frog lives in forests. Scientists saw the frog between 900 and 2115 meters above sea level. They saw it in one protected place: Altos de Lircay National Reserve. ==Young== The tadpoles swim in streams. At one point the tadpoles are 37.9 mm long. ==Threats== Scientists say this frog is in some danger of dying out. Human beings changed the places where it lives: People grow eucalyptus trees where the forests used to be. It is also hotter and there is less rain, which means there are more fires. ==First paper== * ==References== Category:Frogs of South America
title: Alsodes hugoi
